amendment.description: Amendment directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to report to Congress on a review to be conducted by the TSA for preferred and alternative methods of having the airports in U.S. territories comply with TSA security regulations. The report would also address the cost differences and financing opportunities for such airports to fully comply with the TSA regulations.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 11 printed in House Report 111-127 to direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to report to Congress on a review to be conducted by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) for preferred and alternative methods of having the airports in U.S. territories comply with TSA security regulations. The report would also address the cost differences and financing opportunities for such airports to fully comply with the TSA regulations.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Bordallo amendment (A011) Agreed to by voice vote.
